title: Very interesting: take your hobby on holiday
text: When it comes to planning the perfect trip to suit your interests, Saga’s resident expert has a few suggestions in mind. “I think the ancient sites of Pompeii and Herculaneum are a must for any archaeology enthusiast,” explains Tremaine Moore. “And watching celebrated violinist and conductor André Rieu perform with his orchestra in Salzburg will delight fans of classical music, while venturing through St Lucia’s rainforest in search of its tropical winged residents is sure to appeal to birdwatchers. “Special Interest holidays are all about having fun and enjoying unforgettable experiences with people who share similar interests to you. Whether it’s a lifelong passion or a passing interest, we make sure these holidays appeal to everyone." Over time our range of holidays has developed. We now feature art appreciation, walking, archaeology and dancing holidays, to name just a few Tremaine credits the specialist hosts with making all the difference to the trips by developing unique programmes. “Over the years we’ve worked with some well-known names, such as dancers James and Ola Jordan, and Vincent Simone and Flavia Cacace from BBC’s Strictly Come Dancing ,” he explains. “And we’ve just introduced antiques holidays with Eric Knowles, one of the experts on BBC’s Antiques Roadshow . “Over time our range of holidays has developed. We now feature art appreciation, walking, archaeology and dancing holidays, to name just a few. We’re looking at creating an archaeology holiday in South America as our customers are always looking out for new adventures. “That’s why it’s lovely to know we’ve won the British Travel Award for our Special Interest holidays for a second year in a row, it makes me feel we’ve got it right and that’s really rewarding.” For the latest travel news, sign up to the fortnightly Saga Navigator newsletter , or follow @SagaHolidaysUK
